snippet: President Obama is trying to navigate what advisers call a middle course that will satisfy protesting national security agencies while tamping down criticism by civil liberties advocates.
abstract: Pres Obama, as he assembles plan to overhaul nation's surveillance programs, is trying to navigate what advisers call a middle course that will satisfy protesting national security agencies while tamping down criticism by civil liberties advocates.

byline.original: By PETER BAKER and CHARLIE SAVAGE
byline.contributor: Michael S. Schmidt, David E. Sanger and Jeremy W. Peters contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: President Obama is trying to navigate what advisers call a middle course that will satisfy protesting national security agencies while tamping down criticism by civil liberties advocates.

headline.main: Obama Seeks Balance in Plan for Spy Programs
headline.print_headline: Obama Seeks Balance In Plan for Spy Programs

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
